result.markdown:
--- title: "Classification of Antarctic Penguins" author: "Julia Silge" date: "2020-07-28" format: html: notebook-links: true html-table-processing: none --- # Introduction This document explores the classification of Antarctic penguins based on morphological characteristics using logistic regression and random forest models. The dataset used is the Palmer Penguins dataset. # Load Packages ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} library(tidyverse) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── ✔ dplyr 1.1.4 ✔ readr 2.1.5 ✔ forcats 1.0.0 ✔ stringr 1.5.1 ✔ ggplot2 3.5.1 ✔ tibble 3.2.1 ✔ lubridate 1.9.3 ✔ tidyr 1.3.1 ✔ purrr 1.0.4 ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ℹ Use the conflicted package () to force all conflicts to become errors ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} library(palmerpenguins) library(tidymodels) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 1.3.0 ── ✔ broom 1.0.7 ✔ rsample 1.2.1 ✔ dials 1.4.0 ✔ tune 1.3.0 ✔ infer 1.0.7 ✔ workflows 1.2.0 ✔ modeldata 1.4.0 ✔ workflowsets 1.1.0 ✔ parsnip 1.3.1 ✔ yardstick 1.3.2 ✔ recipes 1.2.0 ── Conflicts ───────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels_conflicts() ── ✖ scales::discard() masks purrr::discard() ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ✖ recipes::fixed() masks stringr::fixed() ✖ dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() ✖ yardstick::spec() masks readr::spec() ✖ recipes::step() masks stats::step() ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} library(kableExtra) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Attaching package: 'kableExtra' The following object is masked from 'package:dplyr': group_rows ``` ::: ::: # Prepare Data ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} penguins_df <- penguins %>% filter(!is.na(sex)) %>% select(-island) set.seed(123) penguin_split <- initial_split(penguins_df, strata = sex) penguin_train <- training(penguin_split) penguin_test <- testing(penguin_split) set.seed(123) penguin_boot <- bootstraps(penguin_train) penguin_boot ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Bootstrap sampling # A tibble: 25 × 2 splits id 1 Bootstrap01 2 Bootstrap02 3 Bootstrap03 4 Bootstrap04 5 Bootstrap05 6 Bootstrap06 7 Bootstrap07 8 Bootstrap08 9 Bootstrap09 10 Bootstrap10 # ℹ 15 more rows ``` ::: ::: # Model Specifications ## Logistic Regression ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} glm_spec <- logistic_reg() %>% set_engine("glm") glm_spec ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Logistic Regression Model Specification (classification) Computational engine: glm ``` ::: ::: ## Random Forest ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} rf_spec <- rand_forest() %>% set_mode("classification") %>% set_engine("ranger") rf_spec ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Random Forest Model Specification (classification) Computational engine: ranger ``` ::: ::: # Workflow ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} penguin_wf <- workflow() %>% add_formula(sex ~ .) penguin_wf ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` ══ Workflow ════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════════ Preprocessor: Formula Model: None ── Preprocessor ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────── sex ~ . ``` ::: ::: # Fit Models ## Logistic Regression ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} glm_rs <- penguin_wf %>% add_model(glm_spec) %>% fit_resamples( resamples = penguin_boot, control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` → A | warning: glm.fit: fitted probabilities numerically 0 or 1 occurred ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` There were issues with some computations A: x1 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` There were issues with some computations A: x3 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} glm_rs ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Resampling results # Bootstrap sampling # A tibble: 25 × 5 splits id .metrics .notes .predictions 1 Bootstrap01 2 Bootstrap02 3 Bootstrap03 4 Bootstrap04 5 Bootstrap05 6 Bootstrap06 7 Bootstrap07 8 Bootstrap08 9 Bootstrap09 10 Bootstrap10 # ℹ 15 more rows There were issues with some computations: - Warning(s) x3: glm.fit: fitted probabilities numerically 0 or 1 occurred Run `show_notes(.Last.tune.result)` for more information. ``` ::: ::: ## Random Forest ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} rf_rs <- penguin_wf %>% add_model(rf_spec) %>% fit_resamples( resamples = penguin_boot, control = control_resamples(save_pred = TRUE) ) rf_rs ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # Resampling results # Bootstrap sampling # A tibble: 25 × 5 splits id .metrics .notes .predictions 1 Bootstrap01 2 Bootstrap02 3 Bootstrap03 4 Bootstrap04 5 Bootstrap05 6 Bootstrap06 7 Bootstrap07 8 Bootstrap08 9 Bootstrap09 10 Bootstrap10 # ℹ 15 more rows ``` ::: ::: # Evaluate Models ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} collect_metrics(rf_rs) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 6 .metric .estimator mean n std_err .config 1 accuracy binary 0.912 25 0.00547 Preprocessor1_Model1 2 brier_class binary 0.0664 25 0.00240 Preprocessor1_Model1 3 roc_auc binary 0.977 25 0.00202 Preprocessor1_Model1 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} collect_metrics(glm_rs) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 6 .metric .estimator mean n std_err .config 1 accuracy binary 0.918 25 0.00639 Preprocessor1_Model1 2 brier_class binary 0.0585 25 0.00424 Preprocessor1_Model1 3 roc_auc binary 0.979 25 0.00254 Preprocessor1_Model1 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} glm_rs %>% conf_mat_resampled() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 4 × 3 Prediction Truth Freq 1 female female 41.1 2 female male 3 3 male female 4.4 4 male male 42.3 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} glm_rs %>% collect_predictions() %>% group_by(id) %>% roc_curve(sex, .pred_female) %>% ggplot(aes(1 - specificity, sensitivity, color = id)) + geom_abline(lty = 2, color = "gray80", size = 1.5) + geom_path(show.legend = FALSE, alpha = 0.6, size = 1.2) + coord_equal() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr .hidden} ``` Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0. ℹ Please use `linewidth` instead. ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](ClassificationModel_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-8-1.png){width=672} ::: ::: # Final Fit and Interpretation ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} penguin_final <- penguin_wf %>% add_model(glm_spec) %>% last_fit(penguin_split) collect_metrics(penguin_final) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` # A tibble: 3 × 4 .metric .estimator .estimate .config 1 accuracy binary 0.857 Preprocessor1_Model1 2 roc_auc binary 0.938 Preprocessor1_Model1 3 brier_class binary 0.101 Preprocessor1_Model1 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} collect_predictions(penguin_final) %>% conf_mat(sex, .pred_class) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Truth Prediction female male female 37 7 male 5 35 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#tbl-res .cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} #| label: tbl-res penguin_final$.workflow[[1]] %>% tidy(exponentiate = TRUE) %>% kbl( caption = "Logistic Regression Classigication Model Coefficients", digits = 3, col.names = str_to_title(names(.))) %>% kable_styling( full_width = FALSE, bootstrap_options = c("striped", "hover"), font_size = 14 ) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} `````{=html}
Logistic Regression Classigication Model Coefficients
Term Estimate Std.error Statistic P.value
(Intercept) 0.000 19.620 -5.309 0.000
speciesChinstrap 0.000 2.344 -3.794 0.000
speciesGentoo 0.000 3.753 -3.032 0.002
bill_length_mm 1.908 0.180 3.597 0.000
bill_depth_mm 8.363 0.478 4.448 0.000
flipper_length_mm 1.058 0.061 0.926 0.355
body_mass_g 1.008 0.002 4.591 0.000
````` ::: ::: # Data Visualization ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code .hidden} penguins %>% filter(!is.na(sex)) %>% ggplot(aes(bill_depth_mm, bill_length_mm, color = sex, size = body_mass_g)) + geom_point(alpha = 0.5) + facet_wrap(~species) ``` ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](ClassificationModel_files/figure-html/unnamed-chunk-11-1.png){width=672} ::: :::
